segments.text: I can’t take my eyes off the woman as she polishes that plate, oblivious to everything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so serene in this chaotic kitchen, and it's almost infuriating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see water pooling at her feet, inching closer to disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is climbing higher and higher, risking it all for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His face lights up as he touches the cookie jar, and I feel a pang of envy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the girl standing nearby, her arm raised in anticipation, and it melts my heart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the thought of them falling makes me shudder.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange contrast; outside the window, life looks serene while inside, it’s a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to shout for the woman to turn around and see what's happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t she see the mess brewing right before her eyes?
segments.speaker: PAR
